body_html:
@aselle Thanks for your reply. I just use the following code to test the speed of tf.image.decode_jpeg. It takes about 10ms + for one image. However, cv2.imread only takes 1ms.

def test_tf_image(path):
  with tf.device('/cpu:0'): 
    img = tf.read_file(path)
    image = tf.image.decode_jpeg(img, channels=3)

  with tf.Session() as sess:
    start = time.time()
    out = sess.run(image)
    print time.time() - start

body:
@aselle Thanks for your reply. I just use the following code to test the speed of tf.image.decode_jpeg. It takes about 10ms + for one image.  However, cv2.imread only takes 1ms.  

```
def test_tf_image(path):
  with tf.device('/cpu:0'): 
    img = tf.read_file(path)
    image = tf.image.decode_jpeg(img, channels=3)

  with tf.Session() as sess:
    start = time.time()
    out = sess.run(image)
    print time.time() - start
```
